meanings.definition: A type of undergarment worn by men and women.
meanings.sent1: I wore my comfy gotch to bed last night.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of colorful gotch at the store.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power came from their magical gotch.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunter's map led him to the hidden gotch of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent5: The cozy gotch kept him warm during the cold winter nights.

meanings.definition: To have obtained or acquired something.
meanings.sent1: He gotch a shiny new bike for his birthday.
meanings.sent2: She gotch a high score on the test after studying hard.
meanings.sent3: The cat gotch a mouse in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The detective gotch valuable information from the witness.
meanings.sent5: The chef gotch fresh ingredients for the delicious meal.

meanings.sent1: After reading the book twice, she finally gotch the ending.
meanings.sent2: He gotch the joke and burst into laughter.
meanings.sent3: The student gotch the difficult math concept after extra practice.
meanings.sent4: She gotch the instructions and assembled the furniture easily.
meanings.sent5: The scientist gotch the complex theory after years of research.
